Bug.Summery: [java launching] builder failure does not cause prompt when launching.
Bug.WithStack:
If there's an error in a builder associated with a project, and we launch something in that project, the error is ignored and the launch proceeds.
I used this as my "builder"
<project default="echo"> <target name="echo"> <echo>I am a builder</echo> <sleep seconds="3"> <!--broken here---> </target> </project> The java launcher ignores errors in Ant build files. This was intentional to avoid prompting the user about ant errors when launching Java. In general its hard to know if an Ant build file effects a project's class files (I suppose a builder should).
Deferred for now. Marking as enhancement. As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

If there's an error in a builder associated with a project, and we launch something in that project, the error is ignored and the launch proceeds.

This was intentional to avoid prompting the user about ant errors when launching Java. In general its hard to know if an Ant build file effects a project's class files (I suppose a builder should).
Deferred for now. Marking as enhancement. As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: breakpoint checked state problems

Lines.Line: 1. create some breakpoints (a class one specifically)
2. create some advanced groupings (I used WS as the top level and breakpoint
types as the next level)
3. copy the class breakpoint from one working set to the other

Bug.WithStack:
whenever you copy/paste, or add breakpoitns to a new working set in which the breakpoint will appear in more than one grouping, the checked state does not update for all occurences of the breakpoint.
Steps to produce: 1. create some breakpoints (a class one specifically) 2. create some advanced groupings (I used WS as the top level and breakpoint types as the next level) 3. copy the class breakpoint from one working set to the other
The copied breakpoint will appear as unchecked, even if its other occurence is checked.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 114590 ***

whenever you copy/paste, or add breakpoitns to a new working set in which the breakpoint will appear in more than one grouping, the checked state does not update for all occurences of the breakpoint.

The copied breakpoint will appear as unchecked, even if its other occurence is checked.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 114590 ***

Bug.Summery: Non-Line breakpoints do not update their selection ranges after refactorings which change the type or package name.
Bug.WithStack:
Non-Line breakpoints do not update their selection ranges (which become highlighed when doubleclicking the breakpoint) after refactorings which change the type name or package name.
Example: you have Test.java in the package testPackage, and Test.java contains a watchpoint, a method breakpoint and a line breakpoint. WHen double-clicking on any of the breakpoints, they highlight the appropriate area. After renaming Test to Tester, all the textual selections (not the linebreakpoints, which are determined by line number) will be off by 2 characters. The same thing happens when renaming packages, or moving the type into a package whose name length is different than that of the package in which the breakpoints were originally created. Yes, this was a problem I marked as a TODO in the refactoring code. The implementation issue is that when the refactoring is invoked, the new java element does not exist yet, so I cannot ask for the new name range. *** Bug 128880 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Using RC0, the new type does exist when performnig a type change. Should be able to fix. Debugging in the M6, it appears as the new type, etc., do exist when performing the refactoring, so we should be able to update name ranges. Fixed. Changes in org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.refactoring
BreakpointChange BreakpointMovePackageParticipant BreakpointMoveTypeParticipant BreakpointRenamePackageParticipant BreakpointRenameProjectParticipant BreakpointRenameTypeParticipant ClassPrepareBreakpointTypeChange MethodBreakpointMethodChange MethodBreakpointTypeChange WatchpointFieldChange WatchpointTypeChange WatchpointTypeRenameChange
Updated the change objects and participants to udpate source ranges by computing the handle to the 'new' element and obtaining its source range from the Java model. Please verify, Kevin. verified

Non-Line breakpoints do not update their selection ranges (which become highlighed when doubleclicking the breakpoint) after refactorings which change the type name or package name.
Example: you have Test.java in the package testPackage, and Test.java contains a watchpoint, a method breakpoint and a line breakpoint. WHen double-clicking on any of the breakpoints, they highlight the appropriate area. After renaming Test to Tester, all the textual selections (not the linebreakpoints, which are determined by line number) will be off by 2 characters. The same thing happens when renaming packages, or moving the type into a package whose name length is different than that of the package in which the breakpoints were originally created. Yes, this was a problem I marked as a TODO in the refactoring code. The implementation issue is that when the refactoring is invoked, the new java element does not exist yet, so I cannot ask for the new name range. *** Bug 128880 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Using RC0, the new type does exist when performnig a type change. Should be able to fix. Debugging in the M6, it appears as the new type, etc., do exist when performing the refactoring, so we should be able to update name ranges. Fixed. Changes in org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.refactoring

Bug.Summery: support disabling auto-activation temporarily
Bug.WithStack:
Support disabling auto-activation temporarily. This could be supported in the form of an operation (a runnable). In the context of that operation, if a class from a plug-in that is not active yet is to be loaded, and that would cause auto-activation to kick in, don't load the class, just fail.
This would work well with the Eclipse-AutoStart header.
Use cases: - content type describers are all instantiated when the content type registry is created. Content type providers are warned that content describers should not cause auto-activation (through the use of Eclipse-AutoStart), but that is not enforced.
- the adapter manager ignores factories for plug-ins that are not active. That restriction could be changed to "adapter factories that would trigger auto-activation will be ignored".
I believe this could be used in the context of other extension points as well.
I understand that this mechanism would not help if the work that would cause auto-activation ends up being done in a different thread. An interesting proposal. Would it be bad for people to suddnely start getting ClassNotFoundErrors?
I'm not sure I understand what is being asked. Are you requesting an enhancement to Eclispe-LazyStart to list a set of classes that should not cause the bundle to be started lazily AND should not be allowed to load unless the bundle is already started?
If that is the case who needs to be aware that a ClassNotFoundException will be thrown depending on if the bundle is active or not? Re: comment 1 - the exception message could contain an explanation why the framework refused to load a class ("auto-activation is forbidden"). The client of the proposed feature wants to make sure its clients are well-behaved. A class not found exception here means a bug in the client code (that should not be loading classes that would trigger auto-activation).
Re: comment 2 - what is being requested here is API for running runnables for whose duration auto-activation is forbidden. I don't know about Eclipse-LazyStart (did you mean Eclipse-AutoStart?), but no changes to manifest headers are needed.
The implementation could be based on thread locals. Before running the client provided runnable, an AUTO_ACTIVATION_FORBIDDEN thread local would be set to true. Before starting a bundle, the EclipseClassLoader would check if auto activation is forbidden. If it is, it should throw a ClassNotFoundException.
I am not familiar enough with Java classloading to be 100% sure this is implementable. For instance, are missing classes always looked up, or if the lookup fails for the first time, we don't bother doing the lookup again? If that is the case, then I don't think this can be implemented. The problem you describe sounds very similar to bug 131966, although the solutions are different. Rafael do you agree? Can we dup this bug to bug 131966? If that approach has better chances of being implemented, I am fine with this being marked as duplicate.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 131966 ***
Bug.WithOutStack:
Support disabling auto-activation temporarily. This could be supported in the form of an operation (a runnable). In the context of that operation, if a class from a plug-in that is not active yet is to be loaded, and that would cause auto-activation to kick in, don't load the class, just fail.
This would work well with the Eclipse-AutoStart header.
Use cases: - content type describers are all instantiated when the content type registry is created. Content type providers are warned that content describers should not cause auto-activation (through the use of Eclipse-AutoStart), but that is not enforced.
- the adapter manager ignores factories for plug-ins that are not active. That restriction could be changed to "adapter factories that would trigger auto-activation will be ignored".
I believe this could be used in the context of other extension points as well.
I understand that this mechanism would not help if the work that would cause auto-activation ends up being done in a different thread. An interesting proposal. Would it be bad for people to suddnely start getting ClassNotFoundErrors?
I'm not sure I understand what is being asked. Are you requesting an enhancement to Eclispe-LazyStart to list a set of classes that should not cause the bundle to be started lazily AND should not be allowed to load unless the bundle is already started?
If that is the case who needs to be aware that a ClassNotFoundException will be thrown depending on if the bundle is active or not? Re: comment 1 - the exception message could contain an explanation why the framework refused to load a class ("auto-activation is forbidden"). The client of the proposed feature wants to make sure its clients are well-behaved. A class not found exception here means a bug in the client code (that should not be loading classes that would trigger auto-activation).
Re: comment 2 - what is being requested here is API for running runnables for whose duration auto-activation is forbidden. I don't know about Eclipse-LazyStart (did you mean Eclipse-AutoStart?), but no changes to manifest headers are needed.
The implementation could be based on thread locals. Before running the client provided runnable, an AUTO_ACTIVATION_FORBIDDEN thread local would be set to true. Bug.Summery: [breakpoints] [refactoring] refactoring not updated on method breakpoints

Lines.Line: 1. create a method breakpoint on an existing method
2. refactor the method's signature using Refactor->Change method signature

Bug.WithStack:
when you refactor a method signature, if there is a method breakpoint on that method it is not updated after the refactoring is complete.
Steps to reproduce: 1. create a method breakpoint on an existing method 2. refactor the method's signature using Refactor->Change method signature
The corresponding breakpoint is not updated with the new signature info. Appears the refactoring participants are not considered on a signature change, so we have no way to update via refactoring participants.
This case has a bad side effect. Double-clicking the breakpoint in the ruler adds a new breakpoint on the new method, and does not remove the old breakpoint. Deferred *** Bug 188482 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.
Bug.WithOutStack:
when you refactor a method signature, if there is a method breakpoint on that method it is not updated after the refactoring is complete.
Steps to reproduce: 1. create a method breakpoint on an existing method 2. refactor the method's signature using Refactor->Change method signature
The corresponding breakpoint is not updated with the new signature info. Appears the refactoring participants are not considered on a signature change, so we have no way to update via refactoring participants.
This case has a bad side effect. Double-clicking the breakpoint in the ruler adds a new breakpoint on the new method, and does not remove the old breakpoint. Deferred *** Bug 188482 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: [Help] Search results shows too many icons

Lines.Line: 1. Remove the add bookmark icon from each search result. I'm guessing most
people would want to look at the page before adding it to bookmarks. I guess
this is similar to the "I'm feeling lucky" button on the popular search engine.
You can also bookmark via right click, which should be sufficient because
generally I think people browse a lot more than they bookmark.
2. Remove the open in help window button from each search result. Perhaps we can
just pick a default, and the alternative requires the user to right click.
3. Make the icons smaller, especially the two mentioned above if we keep them.
we can take a shot at this later...
*** Bug 116779 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 117506 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Fixed.

Bug.WithStack:
I'm finding it a little hard to look at search results in the help view, especially with the descriptions hidden, because there are just so many icons appearing in the view. They seem to jump out at me even more so than the text. I would like to see if we can do something about it. Some possibilities:
1. Remove the add bookmark icon from each search result. I'm guessing most people would want to look at the page before adding it to bookmarks. I guess this is similar to the "I'm feeling lucky" button on the popular search engine. You can also bookmark via right click, which should be sufficient because generally I think people browse a lot more than they bookmark.
2. Remove the open in help window button from each search result. Perhaps we can just pick a default, and the alternative requires the user to right click.
3. Make the icons smaller, especially the two mentioned above if we keep them. we can take a shot at this later... *** Bug 116779 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 117506 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Fixed.
The two icons appended to each hit (open in external window and bookmark) have been removed. These actions are still available from the context menu.

I guess this is similar to the "I'm feeling lucky" button on the popular search engine. You can also bookmark via right click, which should be sufficient because generally I think people browse a lot more than they bookmark.

Bug.Summery: [Markers] Tasks view does not clear the priority field when changing to 'normal'
Bug.WithStack:
This appears to be a re-paint issue. When the combo appears for a 'normal' priority item it's aligned on the left side of the column (covering it) but when it appears for 'high' or 'low' priorities then it's right-adjusted to -not- cover the icon. Changing back to 'normal' it doesn't repaint (you just have to force a repaint in order to clear it up...).
We could fix this either by forcing a re-paint or by changing the alignment rules so that the combo is always left-aligned on the column (i.e. covers it)...suggestions ?? This is because there is no icon for normal and so the layout is different There are no plans to work on this currently
Bug.WithOutStack:
This appears to be a re-paint issue. When the combo appears for a 'normal' priority item it's aligned on the left side of the column (covering it) but when it appears for 'high' or 'low' priorities then it's right-adjusted to -not- cover the icon. Changing back to 'normal' it doesn't repaint (you just have to force a repaint in order to clear it up...).
We could fix this either by forcing a re-paint or by changing the alignment rules so that the combo is always left-aligned on the column (i.e. covers it)...suggestions ?? This is because there is no icon for normal and so the layout is different There are no plans to work on this currently

Bug.Summery: [Markers] No feedback for 'Completed' tasks
Bug.WithStack:
There's not longer any 'check box' indicator on the Tasks View so clients can't determine whether a task has been completed or not...
This is a regression... Created attachment 29181 Patch
The issue was the extra space required by the new tree widget. The patch fixes this plus tidies up some issues with the resizing of tables. *** Bug 50492 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Fixed in build > 20051104 verified in 20051113-0100
Bug.WithOutStack:
There's not longer any 'check box' indicator on the Tasks View so clients can't determine whether a task has been completed or not...
This is a regression... Created attachment 29181 Patch
The issue was the extra space required by the new tree widget. The patch fixes this plus tidies up some issues with the resizing of tables. *** Bug 50492 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Fixed in build > 20051104 verified in 20051113-0100

Bug.Summery: [highlighting] Syntax highlighting in CDATA sections does not work (as seen in IBM Web Tools for Laszlo)
Bug.WithStack:
See
http://www-128.ibm.com/developerworks/forums/dw_thread.jsp?forum=472&thread=95938&cat=28
for the description of the problem, and a note from lmandel@ca.ibm.com which tells me to ask you guys about this (you have to use "View source" in your browser to see the note, because the web-site can not handle < < and friends in comments (sic)). For simplicity, here is my comment:
"I'd assume there is no syntax highlighting because any content can be contained within a CDATA section.
I suggest you repost your question on the Eclipse Web Tools Platform (WTP) newsgroup (see http://www.eclipse.org/webtools) where a developer working on the latest version of these tools at Eclipse can answer your question.
Lawrence" What language is this example source? It is Laszlo, which is basically JavaScript embedded in some XML markup. Reassigning to SSE. I consider this an enhancemnt request (so far). So little chance of getting into 1.5.
Please attach sample input, and decribe content type of resource (Eclipse content type, if anything other than "xml" ... in other words, what's the key that these cData sections contain script?
Vote to resolve as will no implement. Might be required for scripting in XHTML. It doesn't work in JSP files either. Is this the same bug or should I file a separate one?
Also, why "will no implement"? (In reply to comment #8) > It doesn't work in JSP files either. Is this the same bug or should I file a > separate one? > > Also, why "will no implement"?
Regular XML files aren't expected to support JavaScript in their CDATA contents.

See

for the description of the problem, and a note from lmandel@ca.ibm.com which tells me to ask you guys about this (you have to use "View source" in your browser to see the note, because the web-site can not handle < < and friends in comments (sic)). For simplicity, here is my comment:
"I'd assume there is no syntax highlighting because any content can be contained within a CDATA section.
I suggest you repost your question on the Eclipse Web Tools Platform (WTP) newsgroup (see http://www.eclipse.org/webtools) where a developer working on the latest version of these tools at Eclipse can answer your question.
Lawrence" What language is this example source? It is Laszlo, which is basically JavaScript embedded in some XML markup. Reassigning to SSE. I consider this an enhancemnt request (so far). So little chance of getting into 1.5.
Please attach sample input, and decribe content type of resource (Eclipse content type, if anything other than "xml" ... in other words, what's the key that these cData sections contain script?
Vote to resolve as will no implement. Might be required for scripting in XHTML. It doesn't work in JSP files either. Is this the same bug or should I file a separate one?
Also, why "will no implement"? (In reply to comment #8) > It doesn't work in JSP files either. Is this the same bug or should I file a > separate one? > > Also, why "will no implement"?
Regular XML files aren't expected to support JavaScript in their CDATA contents.

Bug.Summery: Need to add an XDoclet facet
Bug.WithStack:
Currently, the xdoclet builder is hardcoded to get added on a project during bean or servlet creation. However, with the addition of facets, the xdoclet should be controlled by adding/removing an xdoclet facet. Possibly, a page could be added to the project creation with a link to the xdoclet properties. But then this info could be removed from the bean creation wizard first page as well. Also, existing ptojects could then add the xdoclet builder just by going to add/remove facets on the project. This also leaves propietery annotation builders the option of adding their own facet. Two new facets are added
jst.web.xdoclet (depends on jst.web) jst.ejb.xdoclet (depends on jst.ejb) OK, I don't see the facets added on annotated bean or servlet creation though. I take it this is a defect. Will close this enhancement.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Currently, the xdoclet builder is hardcoded to get added on a project during bean or servlet creation. However, with the addition of facets, the xdoclet should be controlled by adding/removing an xdoclet facet. Possibly, a page could be added to the project creation with a link to the xdoclet properties. But then this info could be removed from the bean creation wizard first page as well. Also, existing ptojects could then add the xdoclet builder just by going to add/remove facets on the project. This also leaves propietery annotation builders the option of adding their own facet. Two new facets are added
jst.web.xdoclet (depends on jst.web) jst.ejb.xdoclet (depends on jst.ejb) OK, I don't see the facets added on annotated bean or servlet creation though. I take it this is a defect. Will close this enhancement.

Bug.Summery: [console] Console View's tab not bolded when a console is pinned
Bug.WithStack: The console views tab isn't bolded when a console that isn't on top is written to. ie, there's another console pinned on top. Not clear what we should do here... unless we have a tabbed view. Deferred. As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Not clear what we should do here... unless we have a tabbed view. Deferred. As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: Remove J2EE Annotations properties main page
Bug.WithStack: The main page of J2EE Annotations properties has a checkbox to enable an active annotations provider. This seems better suited to the project level as opposed to workspace level, meaning a project would have whatever annotation provider it selects in the facets list. This could be the xdoclet facet or a propietary one. Annotations are project facets now OK This is part of a "mass update" where bugs showing "fixed" between 7/1/2006 and 9/27/2006 are assumed fixed in WTP 1.5.1. feel free to change the target milestone if you know a more accurate setting.
Bug.WithOutStack: The main page of J2EE Annotations properties has a checkbox to enable an active annotations provider. This seems better suited to the project level as opposed to workspace level, meaning a project would have whatever annotation provider it selects in the facets list. This could be the xdoclet facet or a propietary one. Annotations are project facets now OK This is part of a "mass update" where bugs showing "fixed" between 7/1/2006 and 9/27/2006 are assumed fixed in WTP 1.5.1. feel free to change the target milestone if you know a more accurate setting.

Bug.Summery: Mark Occurrences fails to recognize a click on a variable

Lines.Line: 0) toggle the Mark Occurrences to on; I've also set the compiler option to
flag as a warning the usage of raw classes without the generic parameters
specified
1) open a Java file
2) add lines
some lines that reference 'myVar'
3) click elsewhere in the file
4) go back to the newly added line and click on the Vector (it should become
highlighted in yellow)
5) add <Integer> to both Vector instances in the line
6) click on 'myVar' - the other instances in the file *do not* get highlighted
in yellow
7) click elsewhere in the file (on another variable in another line) or
outside the Eclipse window.
8) now click on 'myVar' and things work properly

Bug.WithStack:
Version 3.2M2 (Build id: I20050923-1000)
I have the Mark Occurrences toggled to 'on'. Usually works like a charm: I click on a variable and see all its occurrences in the file highlighted in yellow (incredibly useful feature).
I edit a line declaring a Collection object (a Vector in this case) to add the generics '<...>' parameter. The collection name stays highlighted even though I click on the variable itself (if I double-click then the variable gets highlighted in blue indicating it was selected but it still does not get marked in the file.
I am able to get the marking mechanism to work again by clicking on a different variable in the file and then getting back to the line I just edited. It also works if I click on another window and then get back to the Eclipse window.
To reproduce:
0) toggle the Mark Occurrences to on; I've also set the compiler option to flag as a warning the usage of raw classes without the generic parameters specified
1) open a Java file 2) add lines Vector myVar = new Vector; . . . some lines that reference 'myVar' 3) click elsewhere in the file 4) go back to the newly added line and click on the Vector (it should become highlighted in yellow) 5) add <Integer> to both Vector instances in the line 6) click on 'myVar' - the other instances in the file *do not* get highlighted in yellow 7) click elsewhere in the file (on another variable in another line) or outside the Eclipse window. 8) now click on 'myVar' and things work properly
-Regards David Is it a typo or you forgot the () after new Vector in Vector myVar = new Vector; ?
Clearly a typo. Have you been able to reproduce problem?
-David This works for me using I20051031-0010. Please reopen if you have more details.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Version 3.2M2 (Build id: I20050923-1000)

The collection name stays highlighted even though I click on the variable itself (if I double-click then the variable gets highlighted in blue indicating it was selected but it still does not get marked in the file.
I am able to get the marking mechanism to work again by clicking on a different variable in the file and then getting back to the line I just edited. It also works if I click on another window and then get back to the Eclipse window.

Bug.Summery: [MPE] [PropertiesView] Multi-page views can clear Property View entries
Bug.WithStack:
The handling of the selection here is inconsistent at best...try this:
Import / check out / create a plugin project with some extensions in it.
Open the Property View
Open the 'MANIFEST.MF' file (notice that we've lost the entry that was displayed when we clicked on the file in the PE)
Now, alternate between re-selecting a file in the PE (to show its properties) and selecting other tabs in the editor. It's somewhat indeterminate but it appears that if you select a 'text' oriented tab (i.e. 'build.properties'), re- select a file in the PE and then select a tab that has already been displayed then the property view maintains showing the file. If its the first time that the editor tab has been displaye then the property sheet goes blank. (lazy creation issue??)
Also, until you select a text-oriented tab you'll lose the file every time you change tabs, even when switching between two 'populated' tabs... Is this still a problem in 3.3?
PW
Changes requested on bug 193523

Bug.Summery: Automating the charting service tests
Bug.WithStack:
The svg charting service can be automated by first generating a control set of svg file. This control set of svg files will be compared with future test passes.
ID generation should be keep consistent during each test pass so that the controlled svg files can be properly compared to the files generated in each test pass.
It should also be possible to compare the static images generated by the charting service. the test cases are now automated as junit tests. Verified.
Bug.WithOutStack:
The svg charting service can be automated by first generating a control set of svg file. This control set of svg files will be compared with future test passes.
ID generation should be keep consistent during each test pass so that the controlled svg files can be properly compared to the files generated in each test pass.
It should also be possible to compare the static images generated by the charting service. the test cases are now automated as junit tests. Verified.

Bug.Summery: [Help] Unable to delete bookmark in help window

Lines.Line: - Open Help -> Search.
- Search for anything, add a few bookmarks.
- Open Help -> Help Contents.
- Click on Bookmarks on the bottom in new Help window.
- Select a bookmark.
- Click on the "Delete Selected Bookmark" action.
- Bug: Nothing happens.

Bug.WithStack:
- Open Help -> Search. - Search for anything, add a few bookmarks. - Open Help -> Help Contents. - Click on Bookmarks on the bottom in new Help window. - Select a bookmark. - Click on the "Delete Selected Bookmark" action. - Bug: Nothing happens.
This works when deleting all bookmarks, or deleting bookmarks that were added from the online help window, not the view. reproducable in 3.1.1. Sending back to inbox since not being actively worked on. I recall fixing a few bookmark problems earlier.. can you see if this one is still reproducible? Still reproducable in 3.2 RC7, will investigate. Created attachment 46211 Fixes the bug.
The bookmark was being added with the ?resultof parameter in the href. This was preventing it from being removed correctly upon bookmark deletion. Added a method to ReusableHelpPart to parse the href and remove any parameters before creating the bookmark. Patch applied.
This also fixes another side effect of the ?resultof where viewing such a bookmark would result in highlighting of the original search query from which the bookmark was created. This one is also fixed with the patch. This bug is reproducible again in I20070608-1718. Reopening. This should be corrected again for 3.3.1. Created attachment 71212 Patch for 3.3.1 stream
The previous fix was to a piece of code which is no longer used when the add bookmark button is clicked from the toolbar. It instead goes directly to the bookmark manager with the href that the BrowserPart is pointing at. In the case of a search result, this href has the query parameter on it. The previous fix is still required for the case of adding the bookmark from the context menu for a search result.
Since the fix for the BrowserPart toolbar button also needed to strip out the parameter, I moved the method introduced by the previous fix out of the ReusableHelpPart and created a utility class in org.eclipse.help.base called LinkUtil to provide it. Adam can you write a few JUnit tests for LinkUils.StripParams() and attach them as a second patch? This kind of string manipulation utility is always a good candidate for adding JUnit tests. See org.eclipse.ua.tests.cheatsheet.other.TestEscape for an example of such a test. Created attachment 72987 Patch with JUnit tests
New patch includes JUnit tests for LinkUtil.stripParam(). Also makes the method null safe. Fixed in HEAD. Fixed in 3.3 maintenance stream *** Bug 131027 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Bug.WithOutStack:
- Open Help -> Search. - Search for anything, add a few bookmarks. - Open Help -> Help Contents. - Click on Bookmarks on the bottom in new Help window. - Select a bookmark. - Click on the "Delete Selected Bookmark" action. - Bug: Nothing happens.
This works when deleting all bookmarks, or deleting bookmarks that were added from the online help window, not the view. reproducable in 3.1.1. Sending back to inbox since not being actively worked on. I recall fixing a few bookmark problems earlier.. can you see if this one is still reproducible? Still reproducable in 3.2 RC7, will investigate. Created attachment 46211 Fixes the bug.
The bookmark was being added with the ?resultof parameter in the href. This was preventing it from being removed correctly upon bookmark deletion. Added a method to ReusableHelpPart to parse the href and remove any parameters before creating the bookmark. Patch applied.
This also fixes another side effect of the ?resultof where viewing such a bookmark would result in highlighting of the original search query from which the bookmark was created. This one is also fixed with the patch. This bug is reproducible again in I20070608-1718. Reopening. This should be corrected again for 3.3.1. Created attachment 71212 Patch for 3.3.1 stream
The previous fix was to a piece of code which is no longer used when the add bookmark button is clicked from the toolbar. It instead goes directly to the bookmark manager with the href that the BrowserPart is pointing at. In the case of a search result, this href has the query parameter on it. The previous fix is still required for the case of adding the bookmark from the context menu for a search result.
Since the fix for the BrowserPart toolbar button also needed to strip out the parameter, I moved the method introduced by the previous fix out of the ReusableHelpPart and created a utility class in org.eclipse.help.base called LinkUtil to provide it. Adam can you write a few JUnit tests for LinkUils.StripParams() and attach them as a second patch? This kind of string manipulation utility is always a good candidate for adding JUnit tests. See org.eclipse.ua.tests.cheatsheet.other.TestEscape for an example of such a test. Created attachment 72987 Patch with JUnit tests
New patch includes JUnit tests for LinkUtil.stripParam(). Also makes the method null safe. Fixed in HEAD. Fixed in 3.3 maintenance stream *** Bug 131027 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Bug.Summery: Runtime exports get disable on project close/reopen

Lines.Line: 1) Plugin 1, that declares as runtime export package X, with class Y inside.
2) Plugin 2, that uses the class Y from the exported package X from plugin 1

Bug.WithStack:
If you have a project with several plugins:
1) Plugin 1, that declares as runtime export package X, with class Y inside. 2) Plugin 2, that uses the class Y from the exported package X from plugin 1
You declare in the dependency of Plugin 1 the Plugin 2, and put it as optional.
You close the Plugin 1 project, and a errors appears: "The import X cannot be resolved".
This error is correct because Plugin 1 is no longer available, and Plugin 2 makes reference to a package of Plugin 1.
The problems come next.
You reopen Plugin 1, and the error disapears, but a new one appears: "Access Restriction: The type Y is not accessible due to restrition on required project 1"
The workaround is to go to Plugin 2 and save again the Dependency of Plugin 1.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 123426 ***
Bug.WithOutStack:
If you have a project with several plugins:
1) Plugin 1, that declares as runtime export package X, with class Y inside. 2) Plugin 2, that uses the class Y from the exported package X from plugin 1
You declare in the dependency of Plugin 1 the Plugin 2, and put it as optional.
You close the Plugin 1 project, and a errors appears: "The import X cannot be resolved".
This error is correct because Plugin 1 is no longer available, and Plugin 2 makes reference to a package of Plugin 1.
The problems come next.
You reopen Plugin 1, and the error disapears, but a new one appears: "Access Restriction: The type Y is not accessible due to restrition on required project 1"
The workaround is to go to Plugin 2 and save again the Dependency of Plugin 1.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 123426 ***

Bug.Summery: Need a way to go from IDocument to resource path (if exists)
Bug.WithStack:
We keep coming across the problem where we need to go from an IDocument to the IResource path.
Currenly we sort of work around it by getting a Model from the ModelManager, then getting the base location from that, but that seems clunky.
Also, sometimes there might not be a model (like in the case of Javascript).
I came across this when trying to get the content type of a Javascript file.
If I knew the IResource name, I could get associated content type from the platform, but I don't, and the file itself doesn't really have a way to identify itself as Javascript. The editor can use IDocumentProviderExtension4 to find the content type. In what context specifically is this information needed? BTW, remember that any time you say "document provider" you are implying UI ... for many "document" functions/requirements, I believe there should a model/core way to do the function.
Not sure what use cases specifically Phil is after though. Let's do try to "abstract out" exactly what's needed -- if possible -- since technically, a document can exist without (a real) path. True enough, but otherwise this is a dupe of bug 108764, right? I've seen the need for this in jsp usebean content assist, where you are only passed the textviewer and you need to figure out the java project. The specific case is in:
DocumentRegionProcessor#getContentType(IDocument)
for figuring out which ValidatorStrategy should be used for as-you-type validation.
So really what I need is to get ContentType from IDocument, but without using the input stream technique, because that will just return me the content type for Text. I could get the correct content type if I used get associated content type from the platform (w/ filename). assigning to myself, just to have an owner associated.
And, yes, is a "dup" of bug 108764, in a way .. but let's leave this one open, as we may solve our own needs at SSE level, before proposing more work for platform text.
Seeing as bug 108764 has been resolved and from the comments this was essentially a dup time to close this one out. resolving

Currenly we sort of work around it by getting a Model from the ModelManager, then getting the base location from that, but that seems clunky.
Also, sometimes there might not be a model (like in the case of Javascript).
I came across this when trying to get the content type of a Javascript file.
If I knew the IResource name, I could get associated content type from the platform, but I don't, and the file itself doesn't really have a way to identify itself as Javascript. Bug.Summery: [DND] [ViewMgmt] Moving view with keyboard: some drop areas too small
Bug.WithStack:
Use a fresh workspace (ie fast view bar at the bottom). Reset the Java perspective, and try to move the package explorer to the right so that it fills the entire height (the cursor when you drop is an arrow pointing left). Note that the target area for dropping with an arrow pointing left is very small, maybe five pixels. Sometimes, you don't see the left arrow at all because the area is smaller than the distance moved by each keypress. The original bug report was bug 73597, most of which is fixed.
Remy is now responsible for watching the [ViewMgmt] category.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Use a fresh workspace (ie fast view bar at the bottom). Sometimes, you don't see the left arrow at all because the area is smaller than the distance moved by each keypress. The original bug report was bug 73597, most of which is fixed.
Remy is now responsible for watching the [ViewMgmt] category.

Bug.Summery: [DND] [ViewMgmt] Moving view with keyboard: results depend on where you "come from"
Bug.WithStack:
Start with a fresh workspace and move the fast view bar to the right, so that the area is larger. Reset the Java perspective. Use the arrow keys to move the package explorer to the right until the cursor shows that dropping the view would turn it into a detached view. Now (without dropping) press the left arrow key. Note that the cursor remains a "detach" cursor even after you got into the area where it should drop the view at the right edge. Somehow, it matters where you "come from" with the arrow keys. The original bug report was bug 73597, most of which is fixed.
Remy is now responsible for watching the [ViewMgmt] category.

Start with a fresh workspace and move the fast view bar to the right, so that the area is larger. Reset the Java perspective. Note that the cursor remains a "detach" cursor even after you got into the area where it should drop the view at the right edge. Somehow, it matters where you "come from" with the arrow keys. The original bug report was bug 73597, most of which is fixed.
Remy is now responsible for watching the [ViewMgmt] category.

Bug.Summery: [Preferences] PlatformUI.getPreferenceStore() != WorkbenchPlugin.getPreferenceStore()
Bug.WithStack:
Somehow these two preference stores are no longer the same. This is causing all kinds of problems in themes because we're hooking theme listeners to one and then firing changes at another. As a result, themes just aren't working.
I'm going to investigate This might be able to be cleared up by Javadoc... Created attachment 29205 patch Created attachment 29213 Patch against ui, workbench, ide, and tests that removes deprecation warnings.
Also included is a text update for the javadoc. We should merge as appropriate. Fixed. Verified in I20051213-0010
Bug.WithOutStack:
Somehow these two preference stores are no longer the same. This is causing all kinds of problems in themes because we're hooking theme listeners to one and then firing changes at another. As a result, themes just aren't working.
I'm going to investigate This might be able to be cleared up by Javadoc... Created attachment 29205 patch Created attachment 29213 Patch against ui, workbench, ide, and tests that removes deprecation warnings.
Also included is a text update for the javadoc. We should merge as appropriate. Fixed. Verified in I20051213-0010

Bug.Summery: Test Log Viewer: Verdict navigation toolbar buttons do not enable/disable correctly.

Lines.Line: 1.open a test log
2.navigation button on event part of test log are not enabled by default. they
only become enable when you use the "select" button

Bug.WithStack:
If Test log viewer is opened before the test finishes executing, the verdict navigation toolbar (enabled/disabled) status reflects the verdicts contained when the log is opened. While test log viewer refreshes when there's changes to the content of test log, toolbar status doesn't. workaround is to close the Test log viewer and reopen it. Deferring to 4.2. Sizing updated as provided by Bianaca. Targeting to future since not containable in 4.4. As discussed on this week's Test Project call (January 22, 2007), the Test Project will focus on existing P1 - P2/Blocker - Major and P1/Normal and test creation/automation defects (omitting defects dependant on outstanding features) in TPTP 4.4. All other Test Project defects have been targeted to future.
If this defect has been targeted to future and you/originator feel it should be completed in 4.4, please provide the necessary reason as a reply to this comment or a post to the Test Project mailing list (tptp-test-tooling-dev@eclipse.org). We will collectively triage and assess our resources to determine a case-by-case decision. Correction: The Test Project mailing list is tptp-testing-tools-dev@eclipse.org. Reassigning to the Project Lead. *** Bug 218794 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 210742 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** In addition:
[Defect #210742] Log Viewer : navigation button on event part of test log are not enabled by default
Steps To Reproduce: 1.open a test log 2.navigation button on event part of test log are not enabled by default. they only become enable when you use the "select" button
[Defect #218794] The five toolbar buttons in test log are disabled after click some verdicts in event tree
There are five buttons in eventpage of test log: Navigate to First Navigate to Previous Select the verdict type to navigate Navigate to Next Navigate to Last when I open one execution file--events page, those buttons are enabled as long as I don't click some verdict or message in events tree, after I click/expand the tree by myself, the buttons become disabled
For the button: Selece the verdict type to navigate the default value for that button is 'All' ,after I choose one type of verdict(ie.'FAIL'), it will expand the tree contains the first 'FAIL' result, and those buttons are still enabled as long as I don't click some verdict or message in events tree, after I click/expand other tree by myself, the buttons become disabled except the last 'FAIL' result expanded by buttons(navigate to/first previous/nest/last)
no matter what you choose(or use default'All') in the button to select verdict type, those 5 buttons are always disabled after you click/expand events tree except you click the last result expanded by those navigating buttons See /org.eclipse.hyades.test.ui/src/org/eclipse/hyades/test/ui/forms/actions/VerdictTypesPullDownAction.java. Defect #218794 is a regression caused by the model scalability work recently completed in 4.4.0 (see https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=180986#c1). As a result, the new query-based verdict navigation in Test Log Viewer (/org.eclipse.hyades.test.ui/src/org/eclipse/hyades/test/ui/forms/base/TestLogVerdictTraversalQuery.java) does not support navigating relative to a element selection (other than the current selected verdict event) in the event tree, despite the interface (/org.eclipse.hyades.test.ui/src/org/eclipse/hyades/test/ui/forms/util/ITestLogVerdictTraversal.java) defining such methods. If the user changes selection from the current selected verdict event, they have to close/reopen the editor or reselect a new verdict type for the navigation buttons. Created attachment 107135 Patch.
Patch to fix disabling the verdict navigation buttons when there is no verdict in the test log (e.g. 'no verdict').
Patch checked in to CVS (HEAD). Hours worked for the first patch. Created attachment 107192 Patch Part 2.
Patch to fix disabling the verdict navigation buttons when there is no verdicts of the current type. (In reply to comment #14) > Created an attachment (id=107192) [details] > Patch Part 2. > > Patch to fix disabling the verdict navigation buttons when there is no verdicts > of the current type. >
Patch checked in to CVS (HEAD). (In reply to comment #0) > If Test log viewer is opened before the test finishes executing, the verdict > navigation toolbar (enabled/disabled) status reflects the verdicts contained > when the log is opened. While test log viewer refreshes when there's changes > to the content of test log, toolbar status doesn't.
Handled under https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=158284. Created attachment 107200 Patch Part 3.
Patch to fix the following:
-Enabled the verdict navigation buttons when the Test Log Viewer is first opened (opening the Events tab manually or from the links on the Overview tab) and verdicts events are selected in the event tree. Since the TestLogVerdictTraversalQuery does not support iterating non-TPFVerdictEvent events, only the first/last navigation buttons will be enabled when non-verdicts events are selected in the event tree.
-Updated the verdict type drop-down to only change the verdict type, notify the listeners, and run the action when the verdict type has changed.
-Updated TestLogVerdictTraversalQuery.java to support navigation relative to a verdict element selection in the event tree.
-Commented the ITestLogVerdictTraversal.java interface.
Patch checked in to CVS (HEAD). Hours worked to create/test the last two patches.

Bug.Summery: Unexpected newline when using formatter with default settings
[WorkbenchLauncher] Splash on Motif cuts off part of progress
Bug.WithStack:
Since it is not possible to predict the height of the progress bar on a platform, having it at the bottom causes it to look somewhat cut off on Motif *** Bug 115377 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Michael, since you made the change to put the progress bar at the bottom - is the intent to leave it there? Making it one pixel wider in the case of Motif? Actually I mean to CC some designers. They requested moving it down which introduces the problem with progress monitors that have different heights. So I wanted to consider this problem in general, not just changing the settings to make it work. Actually I think it might be nicer in the long run to have a hand drawn progress bar that just uses the colours we provide, this would make it standout less on the splash... thoughts moving to SWT, Kelvin will attach an image of a progress bar with some extra pixels on the sides, that he has some questions about. Created attachment 31295 Motif progress bar on Splash
I don't see an issue of the progress bar getting cut off. There are, however, black pixels that appear on the left and right side of the bar. The black pixels on the left and right are fixed (>20060328)

Since it is not possible to predict the height of the progress bar on a platform, having it at the bottom causes it to look somewhat cut off on Motif *** Bug 115377 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Michael, since you made the change to put the progress bar at the bottom - is the intent to leave it there? Making it one pixel wider in the case of Motif? Actually I mean to CC some designers. They requested moving it down which introduces the problem with progress monitors that have different heights. I don't see an issue of the progress bar getting cut off. There are, however, black pixels that appear on the left and right side of the bar. The black pixels on the left and right are fixed (>20060328)

Bug.Summery: Multi-line commit message end-of-line character in MacOS X uses carriage-return instead of new-line, result in $Log$ keyword expansion misbehavior

Lines.Line: 1) In Mac OS X, create a text file, textfile.txt, with the following text:
# $Log$
2) Within Eclipse, save the file and commit to CVS repository, when prompt, comment with multi-
line comments; press 'return' after each line:
line11
line22
line33
3) After commit, Eclipse reloads the text file in editor.

Bug.WithStack:
Overview Description: In Mac OS X, multi-line commit messages are separated with carriage returns (\r) instead of newlines (\n). When using keyword $Log$ for expansion, the multi-line message were expanded incorrectly. Specifically, multi-line messages are not prepended with expected characters, except for the first line.
Steps to Reproduce: 1) In Mac OS X, create a text file, textfile.txt, with the following text: # $Log$ 2) Within Eclipse, save the file and commit to CVS repository, when prompt, comment with multi- line comments; press 'return' after each line: line11 line22 line33 3) After commit, Eclipse reloads the text file in editor.
Actual Result: The text file contains:
# $Log: textfile.txt,v $ # Revision 1.1 2005/11/01 20:44:24 tchen # line11 line22 line33 #
Expected Results: the textfile.txt should have keyword $Log$ expanded as below,
# $Log: textfile.txt,v $ # Revision 1.1 2005/11/01 20:44:24 tchen # line11 # line22 # line33 #
Build Date & Platform: Version: 3.1.1 Build id: M20050929-0840 on Mac OS X
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 45642 ***
Bug.WithOutStack:
Overview Description: In Mac OS X, multi-line commit messages are separated with carriage returns (\r) instead of newlines (\n). When using keyword $Log$ for expansion, the multi-line message were expanded incorrectly. Specifically, multi-line messages are not prepended with expected characters, except for the first line.
Steps to Reproduce: 1) In Mac OS X, create a text file, textfile.txt, with the following text: # $Log$ 2) Within Eclipse, save the file and commit to CVS repository, when prompt, comment with multi- line comments; press 'return' after each line: line11 line22 line33 3) After commit, Eclipse reloads the text file in editor.
Actual Result: The text file contains:
# $Log: textfile.txt,v $ # Revision 1.1 2005/11/01 20:44:24 tchen # line11 line22 line33 #
Expected Results: the textfile.txt should have keyword $Log$ expanded as below,
# $Log: textfile.txt,v $ # Revision 1.1 2005/11/01 20:44:24 tchen # line11 # line22 # line33 #
Build Date & Platform: Version: 3.1.1 Build id: M20050929-0840 on Mac OS X
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 45642 ***

Bug.Summery: Need a way to add plugins to a feature even though they are not resolved
Bug.WithStack:
Currently you are not able to add plugins to a feature unless they are resolved in the target or workspace. This makes sense but prohibits people from crafting features that work on other platforms (or all platforms). For example, how would you edit the RCP feature. It includes all manner of SWT fragments.
It might be interesting for people to be able to selectively include plugins that are not resolved. perhaps only those that fail the Platform filter. Perhaps some others.
for example, I should not have to have all of RAD just to be able to create a feature that includes plugins that depend on RAD.
Perhaps the option is "show unresolved plugins" Brian, when we resolve the target platform, we currently only add resolved bundles to our state and discard the rest.
This is somewhat heavy-handed. If, for example, the user has the RCP delta pack installed in the target platform, they would only see the fragments that match the current environment which can be mystifying.
Since the state can now tell us exactly wny a bundle is unresolved via State#getResolverErrors(...), we can use that information to discard only bundles that give PDE a headache (e.g. multiple singleton bundles with the same id). The rest should make it into the PDE state.
So check the type of the resolver error of an unresolved bundle. If it's not of type ResolverError.SINGLETON_SELECTION, the unresolved bundle is added to the state.
Created attachment 30076 patch to PDE Core
Patch should make PDEState aware of non-resolved bundles that are not multiple singletons. This should allow users the ability to add unresolved bundles to their features. Thanks Brian.
The patch looks good.
However, you need to break out of the inner loop after setting 'add' to false.
Released the modified patch.

Bug.Summery: Clarify "grouping logical unit"

Lines.Line: 1. It is a way of grouping the imported logs in the Log Navigator view. You
can have different monitors as a way of grouping the logs.
2. You can see the groupings by clicking the down arrow icon in the tool bar
of the Log Navigator pane.

Bug.WithStack:
Got a question from someone who didn't understand what "grouping logical unit" meant in our TPTP 3.3 docs: http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/*checkout*/org.eclipse.hyades.log.ui.doc.user/tasks/teimplog.htm?rev=HEAD&cvsroot=Tools_Project&content-type=text/html
Clarification from Dave revealed: 1. It is a way of grouping the imported logs in the Log Navigator view. You can have different monitors as a way of grouping the logs. 2. You can see the groupings by clicking the down arrow icon in the tool bar of the Log Navigator pane.
This defect is to add this information into our docs. Fixed As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant enhancements/defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. As part of the TPTP Bugzilla housecleaning process (see http://wiki.eclipse.org/Bugzilla_Housecleaning_Processes), this enhancement/defect is verified/closed by the Project Lead since this enhancement/defect has been resolved and unverified for more than 1 year and considered to be fixed. If this enhancement/defect is still unresolved and reproducible in the latest TPTP release (http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/), please re-open.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Got a question from someone who didn't understand what "grouping logical unit" meant in our TPTP 3.3 docs: http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/*checkout*/org.eclipse.hyades.log.ui.doc.user/tasks/teimplog.htm?rev=HEAD&cvsroot=Tools_Project&content-type=text/html
Clarification from Dave revealed: 1. It is a way of grouping the imported logs in the Log Navigator view. You can have different monitors as a way of grouping the logs. 2. You can see the groupings by clicking the down arrow icon in the tool bar of the Log Navigator pane.
This defect is to add this information into our docs. Fixed As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant enhancements/defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. As part of the TPTP Bugzilla housecleaning process (see http://wiki.eclipse.org/Bugzilla_Housecleaning_Processes), this enhancement/defect is verified/closed by the Project Lead since this enhancement/defect has been resolved and unverified for more than 1 year and considered to be fixed. If this enhancement/defect is still unresolved and reproducible in the latest TPTP release (http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/), please re-open.

Bug.Summery: [quick fix] New Quick Fix: Refresh "missing" libraries and paths
Bug.WithStack:
One of the development environments I work in contains many, many windows shares mapped to various NFS mount points via Samba. Sadly, Samba and NFS occasioanlly have issues (as do the machines hosting the mounts) that can result in a brief period of time during which one or more files may "disappear" from the NFS world.
In Eclipse, this can be a major headache. For example, if I define a user library containing 500 JAR files and one of those JAR files disappears at the wrong time, my only recourse is to refresh my projects and do a complete clean/rebuild. It would be *GREAT* if, instead, when a problem such as ... "Project xyz is missing required library: 'Q:\whatever\foo.jar'" ... appear in the "Problems" view, if there was a Quick Fix option to simply attempt to refresh the offending entry instead of needing to refresh EVERYTHING and then do a complete rebuild.
The same goes for ANY entity that is supposed to be on the classpath. I do realize (and applaud the fact that) there is a preference that can be set to tell Eclipse not to consider missing path entries to be errors. But I think this falls outside of that domain. Assuming we had a 'refresh JAR' quick fix, I think it would be too late as the build state is already gone and a rebuild can't be avoided. Philippe, is that correct? Hm, I should probably clarify this request some more. A major part of the inconvenience that is caused is the refresh of literally tens of thousands of files in the project just so that Eclipse will re-scan the directories and library entries that specifically have disappeared. I could probably go pick each individual one out by hand, but that would also be a large waste of time.
Maybe an "easy" solution would be to simply make the quick fix to be a "attempt to refresh all missing library/sourcepath/classpath entries" that would selectively refresh all those things in the project that seem to be missing, without refreshing the other 99% of the world.

Bug.Summery: Run as menu slow in editor for applet
Bug.WithStack:
I20051101-0010
The "Run As > " menu is slow to appear for applets, when invoked from an editor displaying an applet. Also when an applet is selected in the package explorer. No fix from debug yet. There appears to be a performance inconsistency computing the super type hierarchy for types in the default package when more than one project has a default package, and the projects have a different JRE on the build path. JCORE is investigating. This is a caching problem. When you launch Eclipse with the default max heap size, the Java model cache is quickly full if you use 2 different JREs. Increasing the max heap size to -Xmx512M fixes this performance inconsistency as the Java model cache is now function of the max heap size. Also note that if you remain in the same project (thus using the same JRE) you will not see any performance inconsistency even with the default max heap size. Created attachment 29324 (slight) patch
This patch trims back the number of tests slightly, while still maintaining the same functionality and API, in an attempt to speed up the enablement tests.
One of the noted performance issues which occurs is due to the compilation of supertype heirarchies. This is done for tests for JUnit, JUnit plugin, and Applet. If there are a lot of supertypes to be checked it can slow down considerably (a few seconds of delay).
One examined case is when a class that extends AbstractUIPlugin is the context, it has been demonstrated to take at most 8 seconds to fly out the menu. With this patch, the "Java Application/Applet" choices are missing on projects/pacakges (containers), and on class file editors. For example, open java.util.Base64 and the context menu in the editor no longer has "Run As > Java Application". It only has "Run...". Created attachment 29349 (not wrong) patch
Completely my fault, I forgot to uncomment one section after testing. Created attachment 29363 new patch
This patch includes a more generalized test for buildpath items, and provides another test for performing and-wise buildpath tests. please verify Darin. Created attachment 30379 recent
This patch updates the property tester suite to behave exactly as the old ones did for PDE, which adds a slight pruning to the "optimistic" enablement of all menu items for containers. Pruning in this case takes the form of Eclipse Application, Equinox, and JUnit Plugin Test being pruned from list for non-plugin projects. Created attachment 30381 more recent
this following patch is a small update to jdt.debug.ui's plugin.xml file which trims out a few uneeded tests for the Java Application and Applet context menu testers. Applied patch. Re-opening, cuz applet in the context menu is still slow. Moving to JCORE for comment or disposal. It appears to be a swapping issue. Not sure if JCORE wants to address this. Darin, are you seeing the slowness even after increasing the max heap size ? No, when I increase the heap size I don't see the slowness. But I still see the slowness when selecting the same applet from the same project iteratively (with default heap size) - i.e. without changing between projects. Created attachment 31307 additional
This update should be applied in conjuntion with the previous one, it updates eclipse.jdt.debug.ui plugin.xml for the newest tests Moving to JDT Debug to apply the patch.
Otherwise I still don't understand what swapping issue in JDT Core you're seeing. Please provide steps to reproduce. Applied patch. Needs more investigation to see if performance is an issue. Marking fixed. I no longer see the performance problem. (fixed) Verified.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I20051101-0010
The "Run As > " menu is slow to appear for applets, when invoked from an editor displaying an applet. Also when an applet is selected in the package explorer. No fix from debug yet. There appears to be a performance inconsistency computing the super type hierarchy for types in the default package when more than one project has a default package, and the projects have a different JRE on the build path. JCORE is investigating. This is a caching problem. When you launch Eclipse with the default max heap size, the Java model cache is quickly full if you use 2 different JREs. Increasing the max heap size to -Xmx512M fixes this performance inconsistency as the Java model cache is now function of the max heap size. Also note that if you remain in the same project (thus using the same JRE) you will not see any performance inconsistency even with the default max heap size. Created attachment 29324 (slight) patch
This patch trims back the number of tests slightly, while still maintaining the same functionality and API, in an attempt to speed up the enablement tests.

With this patch, the "Java Application/Applet" choices are missing on projects/pacakges (containers), and on class file editors. For example, open java.util.Base64 and the context menu in the editor no longer has "Run As > Java Application". It only has "Run...". Created attachment 29349 (not wrong) patch

Bug.Summery: export file system/archive wizard initally has error when no selection seeded
Bug.WithStack:
Make sure nothing is selected in your Navigator or Package Explorer. File > Import/Export Select Archive or File System BUG: there is initially an error - There are no resources currently selected for export. There should not initially be an error in these wizards. I just noticed that if you have nothing in your workspace and you try to import you get an error message right away that says: Cannot import into a workspace with no open projects. Please create a project before importing.
Perhaps we should have a message like that for export if there are no resources in the workspace to export? Created attachment 30318 apply patch to org.eclipse.ui.ide
There should never initially be an error message. I changed the code to reflect this and also fixed some code optimization warnings. Kim, can you check this patch? Patch applied. Verified in I20051213-0010 Verified in I20051213-0010

This bug was fixed on 26th April this year and included in AspectJ1.5.0M3 - it wasn't fixed in 1.5.0M2. So the fix never made it into 1.2.1 'WONTFIX' means I won't fix it for 1.2.1. The fix is available in final version of AspectJ 1.5.0 (released 20th December) - we have no plans for creating a 1.2.2.

This bug was fixed on 26th April this year and included in AspectJ1.5.0M3 - it wasn't fixed in 1.5.0M2. So the fix never made it into 1.2.1 'WONTFIX' means I won't fix it for 1.2.1. Bug.Summery: Lots of cheese around top of eclipse
Bug.WithStack:
I20051101-1204 (3.2 pre M3)
Just under the perspective switcher there s a lot of cheese.
See attached screenshot. Created attachment 29110 Cheese under perspective switcher Created attachment 29112 More Cheese
more cheese after moving perspective switcher from left to top left If the fix is easy and safe we should consider this for M3. NOTE: The problem does not happen on Tiger. I am closing this as WONTFIX, since the problem only happens on Panther (10.3) which is not a supported platform.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I20051101-1204 (3.2 pre M3)
Just under the perspective switcher there s a lot of cheese.

Bug.Summery: [Dialogs] - PopupDialog with embedded tree has wrong background color on Mac

Lines.Line: - why is the tree background area wrong?
- what did the original AbstractInformationControl do to prevent this
problem? It does not have the same problem.
No idea.
I believe this is a dup of bug #37873
I saw this when first testing the PopupDialog version of
AbstractInformationControl against the original. At the time I thought I was
seeing a regression. However, I just checked it on 3.1.1, 3.2 M3 (pre-
AbstractInformationControl integration with PopupDialog), and on I20051108,
and all of them have the problem. Marking as a duplicate of #37873.

Bug.WithStack:
Using M3 and the information control patches from bug #113104:
On the Mac, the tree's background color is correct for the area with items, but incorrect (white) in the empty area below the items. In other words, if the tree is expanded to take up the full area, then the background color is fine, but if the tree has an empty area, it is not the same color as the item background.
PopupDialog propagates the system info color to all widgets in the tree except those explicitly excluded. - why is the tree background area wrong? - what did the original AbstractInformationControl do to prevent this problem? It does not have the same problem. No idea. I believe this is a dup of bug #37873 I saw this when first testing the PopupDialog version of AbstractInformationControl against the original. At the time I thought I was seeing a regression. However, I just checked it on 3.1.1, 3.2 M3 (pre- AbstractInformationControl integration with PopupDialog), and on I20051108, and all of them have the problem. Marking as a duplicate of #37873.
When I observed it as a regression, I was using multiple Macs, during a time that the SWT/Mac code was also changing significantly. Or perhaps I just observed an expanded tree and mistook it as a regression.
If anyone else thinks this is a regression, please reopen.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 37873 ***

Using M3 and the information control patches from bug #113104:
On the Mac, the tree's background color is correct for the area with items, but incorrect (white) in the empty area below the items. In other words, if the tree is expanded to take up the full area, then the background color is fine, but if the tree has an empty area, it is not the same color as the item background.
PopupDialog propagates the system info color to all widgets in the tree except those explicitly excluded. - why is the tree background area wrong? - what did the original AbstractInformationControl do to prevent this problem? Bug.Summery: Runtime errors on calls to inherited static methods
Bug.WithStack:
When an inherited *static* method is called without naming its declaring class, such as "checkPassed(..)" instead of "Employee.checkPassed(..)", an UnsatisfiedLinkException occurs at runtime with some recent versions of the Java compiler/runtime.
To test the fix for this, find all references to "Employee.checkPassed(..)" in businessdemo, remove the explicit class reference, and run AllBusinessDemoPlainwayTests.
Bug.WithOutStack:
When an inherited *static* method is called without naming its declaring class, such as "checkPassed(..)" instead of "Employee.checkPassed(..)", an UnsatisfiedLinkException occurs at runtime with some recent versions of the Java compiler/runtime.
To test the fix for this, find all references to "Employee.checkPassed(..)" in businessdemo, remove the explicit class reference, and run AllBusinessDemoPlainwayTests.

Bug.Summery: [Import/Export] Import Existing Projects into Workspace - misleading wizard description
Bug.WithStack:
I20051101-1204 Open the wizard Import/Export > Import > Existing Projects into Workspace
Note that the description on the wizard says "Create new projects from an archive file or directtory. This does not copy the project into the workspace."
But now it can... Created attachment 29176 apply patch to org/eclipse/ui/internal/wizards/datatransfer/messages.properties in org.eclipse.ui.ide Karice - is this something you are trying to get in for the next build...ie, did you want me to review/commit? Apparently we are not supposed to be releasing anything until the milestone is declared. ok, I wasn't sure if this was on a list to go in or not. Susan, can you check this patch? I just removed the last sentence. I wasn't sure if I should change it to say something like "This can either copy the project into the workspace or point to the project in another workspace location" or just leave it with the one sentence, which seems to be descriptive enough. Karice - patch looks good. I agree that just simplifying the message is the way to go. It also looks like a mnemonic was added to another message in this patch. Is that intentional? Yes, i forgot to add the mnemonic for the checkbox when i made the patch adding this feature. released to head, should appear >20051107. leaving open for Karice to double check and mark fixed. Created attachment 29552 apply patch to plugin.properties of org.eclipse.ui.ide
The same string appears in two different properties files. The description in the wizard selection page is taken from plugin.properties. sorry this took so long. I applied the patch, actually tested it this time ;-) Released >20051109.
But that begs the question...what is the other key in DataTransferMessages (WizardExternalProjectImportPage_description) used for? I reverted it to the old value and it didn't seem to have an effect. It's used in the code, but is the value overridden by what is supplied in plugin properties? just wondering. The string that was originally changed is set as the wizard's descsription in WizardExternalProjectImportPage which is the public version of this wizard page. We don't reference this page, but I suppose others that we aren't aware of can, so we should maintain the original change. Sync'd and checked that the wizard description is now accurate. Bug.Summery: [Viewers] Add automatic support for table sorting in both directions

Lines.Line: - this one

Bug.WithStack:
As I played around with the new sorting mechanism, I realized that there is no support for easy sorting in both directions, i.e., if I want to sort a column with numbers in decreasing and increasing order, I have to write two ViewerSorter implementations.
I came up with a solution which works pretty good for me, so I suggest adding it to JFace. Maybe it's just to small and easy, so it doesn't make sense to be add it to the platform, but that's up to you... Created attachment 29113 Part of sorting framework Created attachment 29114 Part of sorting framework Created attachment 29115 Part of sorting framework Created attachment 29116 "snippet kind" demo of sorting framework I've implemented some small enhancements to this "framework": You can configure the default sorting direction of each column, and you can choose if a column should remember its last sorting direction or not.
As I don't want to flood anybodys mailbox by uploading my changes, I let you know this way. If anybody is interested in the code, just drop me an email - I'm happy to send you the current version (or upload it if you want). we should move all discussion on this to one bug because currently we have 4 I know of: - bug #182791 - bug #166153 - bug #170187 - this one
If you want you can hand over the resulting bug to me because I'm eager on implementation this kind of function in 3.4. By the way we also have a snippet which might be a starting point. (In reply to comment #6) > If you want you can hand over the resulting bug to me
